intro: Nidularium catarinense, commonly known as the Catarinense bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its bulbous underground storage organs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
